ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: The standard Difference-in-Differences (DID) setup involves two periods and two groups -- a treated group and untreated group.  Many applications of DID methods involve more than two periods and have individuals that are treated at different points in time.  This package contains tools for computing average treatment effect parameters in Difference in Differences setups with more than two periods and with variation in treatment timing using the methods developed in Callaway and Sant'Anna (2021) <doi:10.1016/j.jeconom.2020.12.001>.  The main parameters are group-time average treatment effects which are the average treatment effect for a particular group at a a particular time.  These can be aggregated into a fewer number of treatment effect parameters, and the package deals with the cases where there is selective treatment timing, dynamic treatment effects, calendar time effects, or combinations of these.  There are also functions for testing the Difference in Differences assumption, and plotting group-time average treatment effects.

The standard Difference-in-Differences (DID) setup involves two periods and two groups -- a treated group and untreated group.  Many applications of DID methods involve more than two periods and have individuals that are treated at different points in time.  This package contains tools for computing average treatment effect parameters in Difference in Differences setups with more than two periods and with variation in treatment timing using the methods developed in Callaway and Sant'Anna (2021) <doi:10.1016/j.jeconom.2020.12.001>.  The main parameters are group-time average treatment effects which are the average treatment effect for a particular group at a a particular time.  These can be aggregated into a fewer number of treatment effect parameters, and the package deals with the cases where there is selective treatment timing, dynamic treatment effects, calendar time effects, or combinations of these.  There are also functions for testing the Difference in Differences assumption, and plotting group-time average treatment effects.

name: r-did
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2.3.0" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-did
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/did_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/did/did_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 92bc0af15230bff17e75507845718b0ce6d3249085eeceef598b499565b9e8a3

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  missing_dso_whitelist:
    - '*/R.dll'        # [win]
    - '*/Rblas.dll'    # [win]
    - '*/Rlapack.dll'  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-bmisc >=1.4.4
    - r-drdid >=1.1.0
    - r-matrix
    - r-data.table >=1.15.4
    - r-dreamerr >=1.4.0
    - r-fastglm
    - r-generics
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-pbapply
    - r-tidyr
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-bmisc >=1.4.4
    - r-drdid >=1.1.0
    - r-matrix
    - r-data.table >=1.15.4
    - r-dreamerr >=1.4.0
    - r-fastglm
    - r-generics
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-pbapply
    - r-tidyr

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('did')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('did')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://bcallaway11.github.io/did/
  dev_url: https://github.com/bcallaway11/did/
  license: GPL-2.0-only
  summary: The standard Difference-in-Differences (DID) setup involves two periods and two groups -- a treated group and untreated group.  Many applications of DID methods involve more than two periods and have individuals that are treated at different points in time.  This package contains tools for computing average treatment
    effect parameters in Difference in Differences setups with more than two periods and with variation in treatment timing using the methods developed in Callaway and Sant'Anna (2021) <doi:10.1016/j.jeconom.2020.12.001>.  The main parameters are group-time average treatment effects which are the average treatment effect
    for a particular group at a a particular time.  These can be aggregated into a fewer number of treatment effect parameters, and the package deals with the cases where there is selective treatment timing, dynamic treatment effects, calendar time effects, or combinations of these.  There are also functions for testing
    the Difference in Differences assumption, and plotting group-time average treatment effects.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - JNuss71

# Package: did
# Title: Treatment Effects with Multiple Periods and Groups
# Version: 2.1.2
# Authors@R: c(person("Brantly", "Callaway", email = "brantly.callaway@uga.edu", role = c("aut", "cre")), person("Pedro H. C.", "Sant'Anna", email="pedro.h.santanna@vanderbilt.edu", role = c("aut")))
# URL: https://bcallaway11.github.io/did/, https://github.com/bcallaway11/did/
# Description: The standard Difference-in-Differences (DID) setup involves two periods and two groups -- a treated group and untreated group.  Many applications of DID methods involve more than two periods and have individuals that are treated at different points in time.  This package contains tools for computing average treatment effect parameters in Difference in Differences setups with more than two periods and with variation in treatment timing using the methods developed in Callaway and Sant'Anna (2021) <doi:10.1016/j.jeconom.2020.12.001>.  The main parameters are group-time average treatment effects which are the average treatment effect for a particular group at a a particular time.  These can be aggregated into a fewer number of treatment effect parameters, and the package deals with the cases where there is selective treatment timing, dynamic treatment effects, calendar time effects, or combinations of these.  There are also functions for testing the Difference in Differences assumption, and plotting group-time average treatment effects.
# Depends: R (>= 3.5),
# License: GPL-2
# Encoding: UTF-8
# LazyData: true
# Imports: BMisc (>= 1.4.4), Matrix, pbapply, ggplot2, ggpubr, DRDID, generics, methods, tidyr
# RoxygenNote: 7.2.1
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# Suggests: rmarkdown, plm, here, knitr, covr
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2022-07-20 03:09:38 UTC; brant
# Author: Brantly Callaway [aut, cre], Pedro H. C. Sant'Anna [aut]
# Maintainer: Brantly Callaway <brantly.callaway@uga.edu>
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2022-07-20 16:00:05 UTC
